name: column
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: column
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of several vertical blocks of print into which a page of a newspaper or magazine is divided

example.eg: I didn't have time to read the whole article - just the first column.
example.egtrans: 我没有时间读整篇文章——只看了第一栏。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of writing in a newspaper or magazine, usually on a particular subject, that is always written by the same person and appears regularly

example.eg: She writes a weekly fashion/gossip column for the Evening Standard.
example.egtrans: 她每周都在《旗帜晚报》的时尚／漫谈专栏中发表文章。

trans_examp.trans_en: any vertical block of words or numbers

example.eg: Add the column of figures and divide the sum by three.
example.egtrans: 把这列数字相加，再将总数除以3。

dsense.name: column
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a tall, vertical stone post, used as a support for a roof or in classical buildings (= in the style of ancient Greece or Rome) for decoration, or standing alone as a monument (= a symbol of respect for a special person or event)

example.eg: The roof of the temple was held up by a row of thick stone columns.
example.egtrans: 这座寺庙的屋顶由一排粗大的石柱支撑着。
特拉法尔加广场上的纳尔逊纪念碑

trans_examp.trans_en: a line of moving people or vehicles
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一队，一列（移动的人或车辆）

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: something with a tall, narrow shape

example.eg: A column of smoke rose from the chimney.
